sourceDesc.bibl: The Epic Poem in The Peripatetic John Thelwall Judith Thompson Detroit, Michigan Wayne State UP 2001
Typopictoromania in The Derby Manuscript John Thelwall

projectDesc.p: Our text is Typopictoromania, an epic fragment that was to have been part of a much longer poem. It is epic like Dryden, satirical like Pope, critical like Blake; the fragment reveals the beginnings of a poem that was to use a grand yet cartoonish battle, one between the types of Caslon’s print house and the brushes of Boydell’s Shakespeare Gallery, as an opportunity to ridicule the abuse and abasement of poetic language during the revolutionary period in England. While the poem was never finished, what has survived—a preface, proposition, an invocation, a first canto, part of a second, and a few random fragments, together totalling close to five hundred lines of poetry—are both aesthetically and historically relevant to those interested in the early romanticism of the revolutionary period. While Thelwall claims that he initially intended to write a complete poem, its unfinished nature puts it in the same historical camp as Keats’ Hyperion and Coleridge’s Kubla Khan, texts that are paradoxically whole in their incompleteness. Furthermore, the poem is of particular import for Thelwall scholars; appearing in both The Peripatetic of 1793 and in the later Derby Manuscript, the poem bookends Thelwall’s career. The two copies differ in a great many minor respects, particularly in punctuation, but a significant amount of major variations, where the later Thelwall has rewritten entire lines, are also present; a thorough study of the differences may be valuable for scholars interested in the development from the younger to older Thelwall. Thus, our task is to present a complete and accessible reading copy of the poem, showing a preference to the most recent and hitherto unpublished version (the Derby Manuscript) and including all important variations in editorial notes and additional yet important material in appendices. Furthermore, our TEI coding will ensure that scholars have access to all variations between the texts for the sake of comparison.

div.head: FragmentsThese fragments appear in P surrounded by discussion of Sylvanus’ plans for the rest of the poem. While the poem itself is unfinished, the second fragment is almost certainly a piece of what might have become the final Canto, and thus it serves as a fitting conclusion for the poem while also harkening back to the closing couplets of the Proposition.

app.lem: By his Herculean side sweet handmaid glows,Spelling of Herculean corrected from herculian.
app.rdg: By his herculian side sweet handmaid glows,

app.lem: Fair Hebe, blushing like a full blown Rose
app.rdg: Fair Hebe, blushing like a full blown Rose

app.lem: That full blown Rose, whose shape she once assum’d,
app.rdg: That full blown Rose, whose shape she once assum’d,

app.lem: And bright on Covent Garden Hustings bloom’d,
app.rdg: And bright on Covent Garden Hustings bloom’d,

app.lem: Till Argos eyes detect the treacherous thorn,
app.rdg: Till Argos eyes detect the treacherous thorn,

app.lem: To goad fair Freedom’s side malignant worn;
app.rdg: To goad fair Freedom’s side malignant worn;

app.lem: At which, abash’d, she fled the light of Day,
app.rdg: At which, abash’d, she fled the light of Day,

app.lem: And hid beneath Minerva’s buckler lay.—
app.rdg: And hid beneath Minerva’s buckler lay.—

app.lem: Thus fled the types when thro’ the troubled sky
app.rdg: Thus fled the types when thro’ the troubled sky

app.lem: Dread thundering Jove resistless beam’d on high;
app.rdg: Dread thundering Jove resistless beam’d on high;

app.lem: His awful wig of lightest hair around
app.rdg: His awful wig of lightest hair around

app.lem: A star-gem’d diadem imperial frown’d,
app.rdg: A star-gem’d diadem imperial frown’d,

app.lem: In front of which bright beam’d the radiant stone,
app.rdg: In front of which bright beam’d the radiant stone,

app.lem: An eastern Nabob lately call’d his own;
app.rdg: An eastern Nabob lately call’d his own;

app.lem: Till at the altar of the thundering God,
app.rdg: Till at the altar of the thundering God,

app.lem: In supplication of his guardian nod,
app.rdg: In supplication of his guardian nod,

app.lem: Submiss ‘twas offer’d. Jove, as Gods are us’d,
app.rdg: Submiss ‘twas offer’d. Jove, as Gods are us’d,

app.lem: Receiv’d the offering, but the pray’r refus’d.
app.rdg: Receiv’d the offering, but the pray’r refus’d.

app.lem: —Dread was his presence; in his red right hand,
app.rdg: —Dread was his presence; in his red right hand,

app.lem: Prepar’d to vindicate his high command,
app.rdg: Prepar’d to vindicate his high command,

app.lem: He grasps those thunders Alphabeta’s care
app.rdg: He grasps those thunders Alphabeta’s care

app.lem: Had forg’d the terrors of his will to bear.
app.rdg: Had forg’d the terrors of his will to bear.

app.lem: Now when the adverse conflict he espies,
app.rdg: Now when the adverse conflict he espies,

app.lem: With face of scarlet and grey rolling eyes,
app.rdg: With face of scarlet and grey rolling eyes,

app.lem: Sees types on types dispers’d, dismay’d, or slain,
app.rdg: Sees types on types dispers’d, dismay’d, or slain,

app.lem: And Boydell raging thro’ the ensanguin’d plain:Spelling of Boydell corrected from Boydel.
app.rdg: And Boydel raging thro’ the ensanguin’d plain:

app.lem: Indignant wrath and keen resentment rise,
app.rdg: Indignant wrath and keen resentment rise,

app.lem: And, What! what! what! with thick short speech, he cries;
app.rdg: And, What! what! what! with thick short speech, he cries;

app.lem: But could no more, for choler choak’d his tongue,
app.rdg: But could no more, for choler choak’d his tongue,

app.lem: And what! what! what! thro’ heaven’s wide concave rung.
app.rdg: And what! what! what! thro’ heaven’s wide concave rung.

app.lem: Scar’d Moorfields shakes, clouds tremble as they roll,
app.rdg: Scar’d Moorfields shakes, clouds tremble as they roll,

app.lem: Fork’d lightnings fly, big angry thunders growl,
app.rdg: Fork’d lightnings fly, big angry thunders growl,

app.lem: And what! what! what! chills every victor’s soul.
app.rdg: And what! what! what! chills every victor’s soul.

app.lem: Scar’d Boydell flies, Woodmason’s puff expires,
app.rdg: Scar’d Boydell flies, Woodmason’s puff expires,

app.lem: And e’en thy deamon, Opie, slow retires,John Opie (1761-1807) was a painter popular for his portraits and historical works.
app.rdg: And e’en thy deamon, Opie, slow retires,

app.lem: Jove throws his bolts thick scatter’d o’er the ground,
app.rdg: Jove throws his bolts thick scatter’d o’er the ground,

app.lem: And brands of heavenly fury blaze around.
app.rdg: And brands of heavenly fury blaze around.

app.lem: Thro’ Britain’s empire spreads the sacred ire,
app.rdg: Thro’ Britain’s empire spreads the sacred ire,

app.lem: Prints every gate-house, post, and village spire,
app.rdg: Prints every gate-house, post, and village spire,

app.lem: Whence gazing Rustics, wondering what is meant,
app.rdg: Whence gazing Rustics, wondering what is meant,

app.lem: Read dreadful words of treason, discontent,
app.rdg: Read dreadful words of treason, discontent,

app.lem: Sedition rumour’d, enemies to peace,
app.rdg: Sedition rumour’d, enemies to peace,

app.lem: And dread commands, that Reason’s voice should cease.
app.rdg: And dread commands, that Reason’s voice should cease.
